newsitem.title: GREECE: Greek shares end with mild gains, volume drops.
newsitem.headline: Greek shares end with mild gains, volume drops.

text.p: Greek shares settled with mild 0.33 percent gains after narrow trade on low volume with the benchmark index settling at 909.03. Market watchers expected a subdued market this week.

"Part of the reason for the volume drop is that short selling is not taking place as easily as before. Stocks will be subdued and trade between 890-920 points this week until blue chips attract buying interest and lead the market higher," said fund manager Michalis Elefteriou.

"The market's fundamentals are attractive and valuations are low. But there isn't enough volume by medium-term buyers to countervail short-term profit takers. Blue chips will be the preferred plays in the short term," he said.
On Friday, Italy's Concretum agreed to buy a 12 percent stake in Heracles Cements for 32.23 billion drachmas or 5,320 drachmas a share from National Bank. Heracles closed down 35 drachmas at 3,095.

The Athens general share index closed up 0.33 percent or 3.01 points higher at 909.03 from Friday's 906.02 close after opening at 906.10. Turnover fell to 3.49 billion drachmas on volume of 1.4 million shares.
